page.title: 18Nempnett Thrubwell Church
page.content: Though so sparsely inhabited, there are 2 churches and a chapel in this area. With the decline of relgious observance, many interesting and beautiful churches are seldom used and, sadly, this is the case in Nempnett Thrubwell. The parish has been combined with those of Chew Stoke and Norton Malreward, the church of the largest village (Chew Stoke) being the dominant one, though services are still held at Nempnett. This 13th century church has a Norman font surronded by eighteen little men pulling comical faces and hanging above is the 400yr old oak cover which once locked into place against the interference of witches. Robert, the first rector of St. Mary's, is buried at the foot of the old cross in the churchyard. Every subsequent rector's name is recorded in the vestry.
